lines.content: Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

Welcome to Nee, your pocket task manager!
Show the help message and available commands, by typing `help`.
Nee supports 3 different types of tasks:
Todos are tasks with a description and completion status.
Deadlines are tasks with a description, due date, and completion status.
Lastly, events are tasks with a description, time it is at, and completion status.
Forgot what you added? Nee tracks them for you. You can even mark them as completed.
`java -jar ip-0.2.jar -mode cli` to switch to CLI mode.
`java -jar ip-0.2.jar -mode gui` or simply `java -jar ip-0.2.jar` to use the GUI instead.
Adds a todo to the list of tasks.
Nee has 1 task in the list.
Adds a deadline to the list of tasks.
Nee has 1 task in the list.
Adds an event to the list of tasks.
Nee has 1 task in the list.
ðŸ’¡ Ensure index is within `{1, 2, ... list_size}`
`done 2` marks the second task in the list as done.
Lists all tasks that match the keyword.
`find apple` lists all tasks that contain `apple`.
`undo 1` Undos one command and returns the list of tasks.
ðŸ’¡ Ensure there is a previous command to undo.
Lists all tasks that have been added.
Exits the program and closes the GUI window.

* Tests the inheritance of {@code Deadline} from its superclass {@code Task}.
Deadline testDeadline = new Deadline("Ice latte.", LocalDateTime.now());
assertFalse(new Deadline("Need to get pizza!!!", LocalDateTime.now()).isDone());
* Tests the inheritance of {@code Event} from its superclass {@code Task}.
Event testEvent = new Event("Ice latte.", LocalDateTime.now());
assertFalse(new Event("Need to get pizza!!!", LocalDateTime.now()).isDone());

throw new DukeException("Folder failed to be created!");
assertEquals("This is true.", new Task("This is true.").getTaskName());
Task testTask = new Task("Do you like pizza?");
assertEquals("[ ] Do you like pizza?", testTask.toString());
assertEquals("[X] Do you like pizza?", testTask.toString());
* Tests the inheritance of {@code Todo} from its superclass {@code Task}.
assertEquals("[T][ ] Test todo", new Todo("Test todo").toString());
assertEquals("[T][ ] Get coffee", new Todo("Get coffee").toString());
